markdownRemark.html:
Invite Code

I first go to the website and open the Developer Console tools and refresh to view all of the network connections. I inspect each and the contents that are transferred but don’t see any useful information. I also inspect all of the files being loaded and content on the page.

Based on the lesson from Week 7, I try hacking in through modifying the form but only get this message:

I do see a javascript file being loaded called ’/js/inviteapi.min.js’ which looks like a minified javascript file. I execute this script in jsbin.com but change “return p” to “console.log(p)” to see what it says: "function verifyInviteCode(code){var formData={\"code\":code};$.ajax({type:\"POST\",dataType:\"json\",data:formData,url:'/api/invite/verify',success:function(response){console.log(response)},error:function(response){console.log(response)}})}function makeInviteCode(){$.ajax({type:\"POST\",dataType:\"json\",url:'/api/invite/how/to/generate',success:function(response){console.log(response)},error:function(response){console.log(response)}})}"

Here I see maybe I should do a CURL Post request to /api/invite/how/to/generate!

This gives me {"success":1,"data":{"data":"SW4gb3JkZXIgdG8gZ2VuZXJhdGUgdGhlIGludml0ZSBjb2RlLCBtYWtlIGEgUE9TVCByZXF1ZXN0IHRvIC9hcGkvaW52aXRlL2dlbmVyYXRl","enctype":"BASE64"},"0":200}. I try that code but it doesn’t work, so I see it also says “BASE64” so I try decoding it and find out it decodes to “In order to generate the invite code, make a POST request to /api/invite/generate”. I do a CURL POST to /api/invite/generate and get the response {"success":1,"data":{"code":"VFZJVk4tQVdFWEctWlpWUVMtWUdSSkgtR0FDV0c=","format":"encoded"},"0":200}. I try that code, but that doesn’t work, so I also BASE64 decode that to get TVIVN-AWEXG-ZZVQS-YGRJH-GACWG. That works!

Challenge 1 - Web - Lernaen

I try a few combinations: ‘password’, ‘1’, ‘a bunch of chars to try and overflow it’, Lernaean’ (the title of the page). There’s no files being loaded and just the password param being sent. I see that if I send certain chars, it converts them first before sending. I right click on the POST request in Firefox and am able to copy the curl request, where I am able to try sending my attempts directly by inputting whatever I want. I try a lot of other combinations, trying to hack in via sql injection, trying to send other params such as ‘username’, ‘user’, ‘admin’, but nothing works. Finally I try googling “Lernaen” since it’s an uncommon name.

The Lernaean Hydra or Hydra of Lerna more often known simply as the Hydra, is a serpentine water monster in Greek and Roman mythology.

I google Hydra and https://www.concise-courses.com/what-is-hydra about the password cracking tool.
